Instruction Regarding the Southern Work. 

                                Elmshaven, May 28, 1902. 


     During the night season I have received instruction regarding the work in the South. Some days ago things were presented to me that I could scarcely understand, and that I could not explain by pen or voice. Again, on another day, the same things were presented to me. I had been feeling deeply distressed. My mind had been much troubled in regard to the light that had been given me concerning the work 


                                     -220- 

of my son, J. E. White, in the Southern field.
